USA.history: Founded in 1776, the USA is a leading country in the Americas.

France.history: Known for its rich cultural history, revolution, and cuisine.

Japan.history: Japan is known for its technological advancements and rich culture.

Germany.history: Germany, once divided, is now a leading power in Europe, known for its strong economy and rich cultural heritage.

Italy.history: Italy is renowned for its ancient civilization, art, architecture, and its significant role in world history.

India.history: India, one of the oldest civilizations, is known for its rich culture, history, and diverse traditions.

China.history: China, one of the world's oldest and most influential civilizations, has a history spanning thousands of years.

Brazil.history: Brazil, known for its vast rainforests and vibrant culture, is the largest country in South America.

Canada.history: Canada, a country known for its vast natural landscapes and multiculturalism, gained independence from the UK in 1867.

Russia.history: Russia, the largest country in the world, has a rich history of monarchies, revolutions, and a strong influence on global politics.

Australia.history: Australia, once a British colony, is now a developed country known for its unique wildlife and stunning landscapes.

Mexico.history: Mexico, with a rich indigenous history and colonial past, is known for its vibrant culture, cuisine, and historical landmarks.

South Africa.history: South Africa, known for its diverse cultures and rich history, transitioned from apartheid to democracy in 1994.

Spain.history: Spain, with its rich cultural heritage, was a global empire in the 16th and 17th centuries, influencing much of the world.

United Kingdom.history: The UK, once the center of a global empire, is known for its influence in politics, culture, and the industrial revolution.

Argentina.history: Argentina, known for its rich culture and history, has a tradition of political turmoil and economic changes.

South Korea.history: South Korea is a leading country in technology and culture, especially known for its rise in global pop culture with K-pop.

Greece.history: Greece is considered the cradle of Western civilization, known for its ancient history and contributions to philosophy, democracy, and the arts.

Turkey.history: Turkey, once the heart of the Ottoman Empire, is known for its rich cultural and historical significance.

Egypt.history: Egypt, with its ancient civilization, is known for its contributions to science, mathematics, and architecture.

Thailand.history: Thailand, known for its tropical beaches and rich culture, has remained independent throughout its history.

New Zealand.history: New Zealand, known for its indigenous Maori culture and stunning landscapes, was one of the last places to be settled by humans.

Chile.history: Chile, a long, narrow country along the Pacific coast, is known for its diverse geography and significant cultural heritage.

Nigeria.history: Nigeria, the most populous country in Africa, has a rich history marked by diverse cultures, kingdoms, and a colonial past.

Singapore.history: Singapore, a global financial hub, was once a British colony before becoming an independent republic in 1965.

Portugal.history: Portugal, a maritime nation, was one of the first European countries to explore and establish colonies around the world.

Sweden.history: Sweden, known for its high quality of life, neutrality, and progressive policies, has a strong history in innovation and design.

Vietnam.history: Vietnam, a country in Southeast Asia, has a rich history of struggle and resilience, especially in the Vietnam War.

Indonesia.history: Indonesia, an archipelago in Southeast Asia, is known for its diverse cultures, languages, and the historical influence of colonialism.

Peru.history: Peru, known for its ancient Inca civilization, has a rich cultural heritage and is home to many archaeological wonders.

Saudi Arabia.history: Saudi Arabia, home to Islam's two holiest cities, Mecca and Medina, is a key country in the Middle East with a rich cultural and religious history.

Finland.history: Finland, known for its unique culture and education system, was once part of Sweden before gaining independence in 1917.

Switzerland.history: Switzerland, famous for its neutrality and strong economy, has a long history of being a haven for banking and finance.

Poland.history: Poland, with a history of partitions and independence struggles, is known for its rich cultural and artistic heritage.

Netherlands.history: The Netherlands, known for its maritime history and influence in trade and global politics, is famous for its liberal policies and high standard of living.

Pakistan.history: Pakistan, founded in 1947, has a rich history of cultural diversity, political struggles, and significant contributions to science and technology.

text.headline: Independencia de EE. UU.
text.text: Estados Unidos declara su independencia de Gran Bretaña.

text.headline: Revolución Francesa
text.text: El pueblo francés se levanta contra la monarquía.

text.headline: Batalla de Waterloo
text.text: Napoleón Bonaparte es derrotado en la batalla de Waterloo, marcando el fin de las Guerras Napoleónicas.

text.headline: Inicio de la Primera Guerra Mundial
text.text: El asesinato del archiduque Francisco Fernando desencadena la Primera Guerra Mundial.

text.headline: Revolución Rusa
text.text: La Revolución Rusa derroca al imperio zarista y establece el régimen comunista.

text.headline: Fin de la Segunda Guerra Mundial
text.text: El final de la Segunda Guerra Mundial se marca con la rendición de Alemania y Japón.

text.headline: Llegada del Hombre a la Luna
text.text: Neil Armstrong se convierte en el primer ser humano en pisar la Luna durante la misión Apolo 11.

text.headline: Caída del Muro de Berlín
text.text: El Muro de Berlín cae, simbolizando el fin de la Guerra Fría y la reunificación de Alemania.

text.headline: Atentados del 11 de septiembre
text.text: Una serie de atentados terroristas coordinados destruyen las Torres Gemelas en Nueva York y afectan al Pentágono.

text.headline: Crisis financiera global
text.text: La quiebra de Lehman Brothers desata una crisis financiera mundial.

text.headline: Primavera Árabe
text.text: Una serie de protestas y revoluciones estallan en el mundo árabe, pidiendo democracia y derechos humanos.

text.headline: Caída del Imperio Romano de Occidente
text.text: El Imperio Romano de Occidente cae, marcando el fin de la antigüedad clásica.

text.headline: Descubrimiento de América
text.text: Cristóbal Colón llega al continente americano, iniciando la colonización europea en América.

text.headline: Reforma Protestante
text.text: Martín Lutero clava sus 95 tesis en la puerta de la iglesia de Wittenberg, iniciando la Reforma Protestante.

text.headline: Revolución Industrial
text.text: Comienza la Revolución Industrial en Gran Bretaña, transformando la producción y la sociedad.

text.headline: Independencia de la India
text.text: La India obtiene su independencia del Imperio Británico tras una larga lucha.

text.headline: Discurso de Martin Luther King
text.text: Martin Luther King pronuncia su famoso discurso 'I Have a Dream' durante la marcha por el trabajo y la libertad.

text.headline: Guerra en Afganistán
text.text: La Unión Soviética invade Afganistán, dando lugar a una guerra de diez años.

text.headline: Disolución de la Unión Soviética
text.text: La Unión Soviética se disuelve, marcando el fin de la Guerra Fría.

text.headline: Genocidio en Ruanda
text.text: Un genocidio masivo ocurre en Ruanda, donde cientos de miles de tutsis y hutus moderados son asesinados.
